Pre-Game Insights: England will face Slovakia in a crucial last-16 clash in Euro 2024 after a disappointing group stage where they scored just two goals.
The match will take place at 5pm BST in Gelsenkirchenâ€™s Veltins Arena and will go to extra-time or penalties if there's no winner after normal time.
England's biggest injury concern is Kieran Trippier, who trained but is an injury doubt due to a calf complaint. Luke Shaw is back to fitness but may not play.
In central midfield, Kobbie Mainoo is set to replace Conor Gallagher alongside Declan Rice.
Phil Foden is expected to start ahead of Anthony Gordon, who has been pushing for a starting spot due to his performance.
The match will be aired on ITV1 and ITVX, with coverage starting at 3.30pm BST.
Coverage will be hosted by Mark Pougatch with Ian Wright, Gary Neville, and Roy Keane as pundits.
